head.supplied: Melbourne bot. Garden ¶ 30/10/68 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to express my best thanks for your attentive reply to my letter, ¶ in which I expressed the desirability that phytological collections mig...

div.p: GRG 35/2, no. 68/1055, inwards correspondence, Department of Lands, State Records of South Australia, Adelaide.

I have the honor to express my best thanks for your attentive reply to my letter,
See G. Goyder to M, 21 October 1868, replying to M to G. Goyder, 6 October 1868. in which I expressed the desirability that phytological collections might be formed in Arnhem's Land during the intended survey. Since I now perceive, that already very thoughtfully preliminary arrangements are made for this purpose of collecting, I would merely express my willingness to give an accurate account of such collections, if a full set of specimens is kindly granted to my department after the return of the survey-party.
On 12 November 1868, Goyder minuted: 'Reply that [care will be taken to ensure Dr Schomburgk having the whole of the collection under deleted] & that in all cases where duplicates can be collected they will be secured'. A further note dated 17 November states: 'Acted on'.
See also J. Blackmore to M, 26 May 1869 (in this edition as 69-05-26b).
